data.challenge: As you use water this week ask God to quench your thirst.
data.quoteContent: God is a spring of living water which flows unceasingly into the hearts of those who pray

data.challenge: Read Psalm 23 again slowly and know God’s care for you.
data.prayer: Thank God for his amazing love and care for us.
data.quoteContent: A true shepherd leads the way. He does not merely point the way
data.title: Soul refreshment
data.thought:
What qualities does a shepherd need to do their job?

In what ways is Jesus like a shepherd?

How does this psalm make you feel about God’s care for you?

data.quoteContent: Sometimes we can become oblivious to the dryness of our own soul
data.prayer: Pray for people you know facing an ‘impossible’ life situation.
data.thought:
Have you or someone you know ever faced an impossible task? 

God could have brought the bones to life himself. Why did he use Ezekiel?

How can God revive you in a personal situation when hope is lost?
data.challenge: Remember no matter how dried up and useless you may feel, God can restore you to life
data.title: Mission impossible

data.quoteContent: Hollywood is all about making an entrance. I don't want to be a walking advertisement for anyone other than myself
data.prayer: Thank God that Jesus was not the king that the people expected.
data.title: Making an entrance
data.challenge: Put a cross in a window during holy week so everyone can see it.
data.thought:
Have you ever made a grand entrance, what happened? 

Jesus made his grand entrance. How did the crowd react and why?

Why do you think we have palm crosses on Palm Sunday?

List different things that the world places hope in.

How would you have felt if you were at the empty tomb and then met the living Jesus?

What does Jesus’ resurrection mean to you?
data.quoteContent: Resurrection means that the worst thing is never the last thing
data.challenge: Take photos of things that remind you of new life and resurrection.
data.title: He's alive!
data.prayer: Pray the resurrection of Jesus impacts your daily life, not just at Easter.

data.title: Seeing is believing!
data.prayer: Pray for friends and family that find it hard to believe in Jesus.
data.challenge: Ask an older Christian to share their faith story with you.
data.thought:
What does ‘seeing is believing’ mean to you? Is this always true?

Why do you think Thomas didn’t believe the disciples’ story?

Are there times when you find it hard to believe?
data.quoteContent: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe
Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase
data.title: Believing is seeing!
data.thought:
If Jesus were alive today would the world recognise Him?

Why do you think God kept the disciples from recognising Jesus?

How can you help others to recognise Jesus?
data.prayer: Pray that God reveals himself to you when you least expect it.
data.challenge: Next time you are faced with a dilemma, think ‘what would Jesus do?’
Do something that you love to do that also pleases God.
data.quoteContent: Everything has been figured out, except how to live
data.thought:
Have you ever had something stolen, how did it feel? 

Why does Jesus refer to himself as the gate for the sheep?

What do you think Jesus means in John 10: 10?
data.prayer: Ask God to help you live life to the full in Him.
data.title: Life to the max

data.thought:
When have you felt really stressed? Did you wonder where God was?

What did the writer of these verses believe the Lord could do for them?

During tough times what reminds you that God is your rock and refuge?
data.prayer: Ask God to be your rock and refuge using the words from Psalm 31: 1-5.
data.title: Dial 999
data.challenge: Re-read verses 2-3 every day and memorise them word for word.
data.quoteContent: God did not rescue me out of the pain. He rescued me through the pain

data.thought:
How easy do you find doing good things?

How does Peter encourage his readers to go about doing good? 

What is the hope we have in Jesus?
data.title: Doing good
data.prayer: Pray that you keep focused on Jesus and be ready to share the hope He brings.
data.quoteContent: Doing good to others is not a duty. It is a joy, for it increases your own health and happiness
data.challenge: Look for an opportunity to share with someone the hope you have in Jesus.

data.title: Waiting for the promised gift
data.prayer: Pray that God gently reveals himself to you through His Holy Spirit.
data.challenge: Next time you are challenged, invite the Holy Spirit to help you.
data.thought:
Have you ever witnessed something amazing? 

Imagine you are in the room that day. What emotions are you experiencing?

How open are you to receiving God’s gift of the Holy Spirit?
data.quoteContent: If we wait until we're ready, we'll be waiting for the rest of our lives

data.challenge: Ask the Holy Spirit to guide you to someone who needs prayer this week.
data.quoteContent: The idea of waiting for something makes it more exciting
data.title: The promised gift
data.prayer: Quietly focus and as you breathe in say ‘Come Holy Spirit’.
data.thought:
What is the best gift you have received?

The Holy Spirit is a gift from God. How does Acts 2 describe this gift?

In what ways does the Holy Spirit help Christians in their daily lives?

data.challenge: Go and talk to someone and explain why you follow Jesus.
data.thought:
A disciple is a follower of Jesus. How do you try to follow Jesus? 

What does Jesus mean when he says, “I will be with you always”? 

In verse 19 Jesus commands his followers to ‘go’. What ways you can tell others about Jesus?
data.quoteContent: The church that does not evangelise will fossilise
data.prayer: Ask God for confidence in talking to people about Jesus.
data.title: Passing it on

data.thought:
What things make you truly joyful?

Why is God worthy of our thanks, praise and worship?

What are the benefits of knowing God’s love endures forever? How does that make you feel?
data.title: Love endured
data.quoteContent: The world changes – circumstances change, we change, but God’s word never changes
data.prayer: Thank God that he is good and that his love endures forever.
data.challenge: Spend some time each day listening to worship music.

data.thought:
How does it feel when you are misunderstood?

What different emotions and feelings does Jeremiah speak about?

Can you identify with any of the things Jeremiah says?
data.prayer: Pray for Christians in the world who suffer because of their faith.
data.challenge: Watch the news and pray for each situation.
data.quoteContent: But I suppose the most revolutionary act one can engage in is to tell the truth
data.title: Tough times

data.challenge: Scan through your contacts – who needs to hear that God loves them?
data.thought:
Why is the word ‘sin’ so important to the Christian faith?

What do you think Paul means when he says we are ‘slaves to sin’?

Read Romans 6: 11-14. What frees us from sin and leads us to righteousness?
data.quoteContent: You can drift into sin, but not into righteousness
data.title: Righteousness
data.prayer: Thank God that by His grace you have been set free from sin.

data.title: Come to me
data.thought:
Have you ever been weary or burdened? What did it feel like?

A yoke trains young oxen to plough by linking them to mature oxen. Why do you think Jesus used this metaphor?

How are the words of Jesus reassuring to his followers?
data.prayer: Spend time in prayer focusing on Jesus’ words in verse 29.
data.challenge: If you know someone who is stressed help ease their burdens this week.
data.quoteContent: Anyone who truly walks with God, walks humbly. The closer we draw near to Him, the more we behold His Majesty!

data.title: Light the way
data.prayer: Pray you can be a light that points others to find God.
data.challenge: Be obedient to parents, teachers and God – it may not be as easy as you think!
data.quoteContent: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light
data.thought:
Have you ever experienced total darkness? What did it feel like?

‘Your word is a lamp for my feet’. What do you think verse 105 means?

The psalm mentions obeying God’s laws. What are they and how are you obedient?

data.title: You know me
data.thought:
What does the reading say about how God knows you?

Which verses do you find comforting/challenging?

How does this passage inspire you to live as a Christian?
data.quoteContent: God not only loves me as I am, but also knows me as I am
data.challenge: Do something this week that shows others that you are a Christian.
data.prayer: Ask God to help you live totally for him.

data.challenge: When faced with a challenge this week ask God for wisdom.
data.thought:
What is wisdom? When have you experienced wisdom?

Solomon could have asked God for anything. Why do you think he asked for wisdom?

What is the difference between knowledge and wisdom?
data.quoteContent: God gives us people to love and things to use, not things to love and people to use
data.title: Wisdom
data.prayer: Ask God to help you to know the difference between right and wrong.

data.quoteContent: God sometimes takes us into troubled waters. Not to drown us but to cleanse us
data.title: Wrestling with God
data.challenge: Write a journal expressing your struggles and blessings from God.
data.prayer: Ask God to bless you through the things you are wrestling with.
data.thought:
Have you been in a situation where you wrestled over what to do?

Who do you think Jacob was wrestling with?

Jacob was forever changed after this encounter with God. How has God changed you?

data.challenge: Be courageous this week – step out in faith!
data.title: When focus is lost
data.prayer: Thank God that when life gets scary, He is always in control.
data.thought:
Have you been on a boat? What was it like?

Do you think Peter was courageous or crazy to get out of the boat?

What can you learn about Jesus from this passage?
data.quoteContent: If you want to walk on water, you have to get out of the boat

data.title: Living in unity
data.challenge: Find out about churches in your area. Visit their buildings or arrange a joint event.
data.quoteContent: Alone we can do so little. Together we can do so much
data.thought:
How many different churches can you name? What makes them different?

What does Psalm 133 say about unity?

How can churches better live and work together?
data.prayer: Pray for Christians in other local churches.

data.title: Be transformed
data.thought:
Who are the top five people that influence you?

Read verse 2. How is this a challenge for Christians today?

What does it take to be a good influencer to others?
data.challenge: Consider this week what you are doing and why you are doing it?
data.prayer: Ask for God’s help fighting the influences that lead you away from Him.
data.quoteContent: Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new

data.title: Holy ground
data.prayer: Pray God speaks to you through words, images, senses and emotions.
data.thought:
God called Moses from a bush. Can you list other examples of God speaking in the Bible?

Why did Moses’ mood change from fascination (v3) to frightened (v6)?

How do Christians know when God is speaking to them?
data.quoteContent: Tread softly! All the earth is holy ground
data.challenge: Note down every moment when you feel God is speaking to you.

data.title: Law of love
data.challenge: Try this week to show love to someone in practical ways
data.thought:
What or who do you love most in the world?

What does the reading teach you about the importance of love?

What are the biggest challenges in loving your neighbour as yourself?
data.quoteContent: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend
data.prayer: Ask God to help you love other as He loves you.

data.challenge: Start each day this week saying The Lord’s Prayer
data.prayer: Pray God helps you forgive something you have found hard to forgive.
data.thought:
Is there anything that is unforgivable? Why?

Why does Jesus imply that you must forgive someone so many times?

What does the reading say about forgiveness and not forgiving?
data.quoteContent: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them
data.title: Keep forgiving

data.quoteContent: You say to God, “I have never seen you provide for me.” God says to you, “You have never trusted me”
data.thought:
What have you complained about recently? Was it worth it?

The Israelites grumbled about food! How did they feel when they saw the quail and bread?

What is the difference between ‘wanting’ and ‘needing’? What do you need from God?
data.title: Bread of heaven
data.prayer: Pray about some of the things you’ve complained about recently.
data.challenge: Bake someone a cake or buy food for a local food bank or similar.

data.prayer: Ask God to help you become more like Jesus every day.
data.thought:
When have you looked out for the interests of others?

What does the writer say about Jesus in these verses?

What could you do to imitate Christ more in your daily life?
data.title: Imitating Christ
data.challenge: Ask someone to support you in your quest to be more like Jesus!
data.quoteContent: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less

data.title: Ultimate goal
data.quoteContent: I don't focus on what I'm up against. I focus on my goals and I try to ignore the rest
data.challenge: Go for a walk and talk to God about your aspirations and goals.
data.prayer: Ask God to help you to press on to all he has for you.
data.thought:
How competitive are you? Do you always try to win?

What is the prize that Paul is talking about in his letter?

As Christians, what do you think the ultimate goal should be?

data.challenge: Rewrite Psalm 150 as your praise to God this week.
data.quoteContent: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time
data.thought:
What do you think about the quote from Friedrich Nietzsche?

What does the psalm say about praising God?

List the different ways you can praise God.
data.prayer: Choose a phrase from the Psalm and use it as a prayer.
data.title: Praise the Lord

data.quoteContent: The important thing is not what they think of me, but what I think of them
data.title: Words and actions
data.thought:
A hypocrite says one thing but does another. Have you experienced this?
 
Why does Jesus call the religious leaders hypocrites?

How much of your life do you divide up between God and other stuff?
data.prayer: Ask God to prompt you when your words do not match your actions.
data.challenge: Give an extra hour of your time this week to serve God.

data.quoteContent: God's love has no limits, it lasts forever
data.thought:
Which is easier – loving God or loving your neighbour?

Jesus also said, ‘love your enemies’. Are there examples when Jesus did this?

Who do you need to love first, yourself or your neighbour? Why?
data.prayer: Who do you struggle with? Pray God changes your attitude towards them.
data.challenge: Read Deuteronomy 6: 5 and Leviticus 19: 18 – how do they link to today’s reading?
data.title: God is number one

data.thought:
What makes a good parent, what sort of things do they do?
 
How does God the Father show his love to all his children?

How can you show others you are a child of God?
data.title: Children of God
data.challenge: Do something kind for someone who cares for you.
data.quoteContent: Just because you are a child of God, that doesn’t mean you can act like a child
data.prayer: Pray for all parents, grandparents, carers and guardians.

data.challenge: Read a different page of the Bible each day.
data.title: Serving God
data.prayer: Ask God to help you to serve Him more faithfully.
data.thought:
The reading focuses on serving God. What ways do you serve God?

What was Joshua’s warning to the people and how did they respond?

How can you give more of your time and energy to serving God?
data.quoteContent: How do you know you have a servant’s heart? Look at your reaction when you are treated like one

data.thought:
Have you been given something valuable to look after? How did it make you feel?

What is going on in this parable? Is it fair?

How can you responsibly use the talents/gifts God has given to you?
data.prayer: Ask God to reveal a new talent/gift within you.
data.title: Use it wisely!
data.challenge: Make a card celebrating a friend’s talent/gift. Hide it where they might find it.
data.quoteContent: To whom much is entrusted, much is required
You are always one defining decision away from a totally different life
data.prayer: Pray that your actions flow out of your relationship with Jesus.
data.thought:
Can you think of a time when you were in need and someone helped you?

Look up verses 40 and 45 – what does Jesus mean by this?

How do Jesus’ words challenge how you act?
data.title: Sheep and goats
data.challenge: Think about your actions towards others: are you willing to help the least and the lost?
